name: endure
content:
endure verb
(EXPERIENCE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 [ T ] to suffer something difficult, unpleasant, or painful: We had to endure a nine-hour delay at the airport. She's already had to endure three painful operations on her leg.
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
to accept or continue in a situation that is difficult or unpleasantbearI will bear the responsibility for whatever happens.endureShe endured years of hip pain before seeing a surgeon.sufferShe suffers from severe asthma. acceptI have finally accepted that I can't change who he is.resign yourself toI have resigned myself to the fact that I'll never work again.become resigned toPeople have become resigned to the fact that increased security means much longer wait times at airports.
